alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms capable of producing cold air funnels will impact portions of east central Fergus County through 415 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, the public reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles northeast of Roy to 23 miles west of Crooked Creek Rec Area. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Cold air funnels, and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Fergus County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
